wikipedia_page.main: Neil David Robinson (born 18 November 1979) is an English former professional footballer. He is the son of former professional footballer Neil Robinson.

response: Burnham was the honorary chairman of Leigh Centurions for a short time and is now an honorary vice-president. Burnham was a talented junior cricketer (playing for Lancashire CCC Juniors) and keen footballer, and competed at both sports for his college. He has played for Labour's "Demon Eyes" football team and is a lifelong fan of Premier League football club Everton. In July 2003, Burnham played for Conference club Leigh RMI in a pre-season friendly against Everton. He came on as an 88th minute substitute for Neil Robinson in the 1–1 draw at Hilton Park.
* Neil Robinson (footballer, born 1979), English football player for Macclesfield
* Neil Robinson (footballer, born 1957), English football player for Everton and Grimsby Town
* Neil Robinson (motorcyclist) (1962–1986), motorcycle racer from Northern Ireland
* Neil Robinson (table tennis), Great Britain table tennis player
* Neil Robinson (actor) (1935–1997), English actor in The Wringer
* Neil Robinson (baseball) (1908–1983), Negro league baseball player

Neil Robinson (born 20 April 1957) is a former footballer. The youngest of a family of 7 children (6 boys, 1 girl), he played for Everton, Swansea City, Grimsby Town and Darlington.http://www.evertonfc.com/players/n/nr/neil-robinson
